I have a basic 1.02 related question for this challenge... I have not gotten as far as to try out mining. So: Is refuelling through mining possible on Kerbin (=are there abundant ore deposits around)? You just did. Welcome to the challenge and good luck changing those tires should you have a flat. While everyone may think the Mun is an easy go-around, they quickly forget just how huge, and steep those craters are. Good luck and I'll have a Mun badge for you should you succeed.

And you don't have to worry about flags till you stop for the day, and even then, they're more to help everyone see where you've been. Some of my flags were... oh... 500+ km apart.

I'm throwing my name into the mix! I'm doing a Kerbin circumnavigation, a sightseeing tour. I'm going to be using a long-haul truck and am tuning it up as we speak. I think I'm likely going to do a couple of little videos to show how I'm doing, and will definitely make a mission report and post my craft in the Spacecraft Exchange when the challenge is done.

I plan on visiting KSC 2, the big crater thingy, and all anomalies on the Kerbin landmasses except for one at -28.8083, -13.4401 on [this Map](http://www.kerbalmaps.com/). I won't be going over the sea, so I'm using the northern ice cap to do my circumnavigating.

Fengist, sign me up for another challenge: The Eeloo Circumnavigation. Being inspired by the probe shooting past Pluto in a few months, I decided what better way to celebrate by making a base on Eeloo, and of course driving around it for craps and giggles. Expect more updates on this soon.

Glad to hear it guys. Let me know when you get your mission report up and going and I'll add you to the list of contenders on the front page...

Ooh, and one more thing. I'm using all stock parts, except for my wheels which I am modifying the values of to make them tougher. I'm not sure if that disqualifies me for stock but I'll do it anyway, just to make sure I can have wheels that will survive the rigors of the journey without breaking so much.
